body_html:
(I am on 1.1rc1) Not sure if this "issue" was introduced by this PR, but this seems odd to me:

The smoothed line (dark purple is not defined for the last N steps). If the implication is that smoothing cannot be calculated for these values, then I would argue the same should apply for the first N steps as well.

Rather I would prefer smoothing to be defined all the way to the left and right with a reduced window (which is what I assume happens initially) on both sides.
body_text:
(I am on 1.1rc1) Not sure if this "issue" was introduced by this PR, but this seems odd to me:

The smoothed line (dark purple is not defined for the last N steps). If the implication is that smoothing cannot be calculated for these values, then I would argue the same should apply for the first N steps as well.
Rather I would prefer smoothing to be defined all the way to the left and right with a reduced window (which is what I assume happens initially) on both sides.
body:
(I am on 1.1rc1) Not sure if this "issue" was introduced by this PR, but this seems odd to me:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/51059/24732034/1a9ebe26-1a3c-11e7-9399-f85c8cfea9ac.png)
The smoothed line (dark purple is not defined for the last N steps). If the implication is that smoothing cannot be calculated for these values, then I would argue the same should apply for the first N steps as well. 

Rather I would prefer smoothing to be defined all the way to the left and right with a reduced window (which is what I assume happens initially) on both sides.
